position_checker.py
Go to the documentation of this file.
1 #!/usr/bin/env python
2 
3 """!@brief PositionChecker module to calculate the lights currently present in the robots FoV.
4 
5 @details Subscribes to the robot's ground truth position data and calculates its distance to every light in the
6 simulation. Lights currently in the FoV can be passed to other modules with via callbacks.
7 
8 @file position_checker.py PositionChecker class.
9 
10 @author Martin Schuck
11 
12 @date 19.09.2020
13 """
14 
15 import numpy as np
16 from numba import jit
17 
18 import rospy
19 from nav_msgs.msg import Odometry
20 
21 
22 class PositionChecker:
23  """!@brief Contains all logic for distance calculation and index selection.
24 
25  @details The PositionChecker is triggered by the robot's ground truth position data messages. Therefore, the
26  frequency of the PositionChecker is dependent on the topic frequency!
27  """
28 
29  def __init__(self, light_positions, odom_topic, *, distance_threshold=100, max_lights=20, callbacks=[]):
30  """!@brief PositionChecker constructor.
31 
32  @details Initializes the subscriber and callbacks. Also compiles the numba accelerated index selection function.
33 
34  @param light_positions Array of light positions. Array should be of dimensions np.ndarray(x,2). The rows are x
35  and y coordinate of the lights respectively.
36  @param odom_topic The ROS topic that the robot's odometry is published at.
37  @param distance_threshold Maximum light rendering distance in meters. Default 100.
38  @param max_lights Maximum amount of lights chosen at the same time.
39  @param callbacks List of callbacks to execute when finishing an index selection.
40 
41  @note Numba compilation might take some time. For more information, see @ref __check_lights_boost.
42  """
43  self.light_positions = light_positions
44  self.distance_threshold = distance_threshold
45  self.max_lights = max_lights
46  self.start_callback = False
47  self.ground_truth_subscriber = rospy.Subscriber(odom_topic, Odometry, self._odometry_callback)
48  self.callbacks = callbacks
49  self.__init_numba_jit()
50 
51  def start(self):
52  """!@brief Starts the PositionChecker.
53 
54  @details Sets the ground truth position callback lock flag. Callback is locked during initialization to avoid
55  startup errors.
56  """
57  self.start_callback = True
58  rospy.loginfo("Started PositionChecker.")
59 
60  def _odometry_callback(self, odom):
61  """!@brief Callback for the ground truth position subscriber.
62 
63  @details Acts as a wrapper to @ref __check_lights_boost. Extracts the position from the odometry data and calls
64  the compiled function. Executes all callbacks with the array of active lights indices on completion.
65 
66  @param odom Ground truth odometry data from the subscriber.
67  """
68  if self.start_callback:
69  position = np.array([odom.pose.pose.position.x, odom.pose.pose.position.y])
70  active_lights = self.__check_lights_boost(self.light_positions, position, self.distance_threshold,
71  self.max_lights)
72  active_lights = active_lights[active_lights >= 0]
73  for callback in self.callbacks:
74  callback(active_lights)
75 
76  @staticmethod
77  @jit(nopython=True, cache=True)
78  def __check_lights_boost(light_positions, position, distance_threshold, max_lights):
79  """!@brief Numba accelerated indices selection function.
80 
81  @details Calculates the distance from the robot to all lights. If more than max_lights are found to be within
82  the threshold, orders the lights and selects the max_lights closest ones. If not, selects all lights within the
83  threshold.
84 
85  @param light_positions Array of light positions. Array should be of dimensions np.ndarray(x,2). The rows are x
86  and y coordinate of the lights respectively.
87  @param position Current robot position. Should be of type np.ndarray(2,).
88  @param distance_threshold Maximum light rendering distance in meters.
89  @param max_lights Maximum amount of lights chosen at the same time.
90 
91  @return The indices of lights within the FoV, restricted by the maximum number of lights. If less than
92  max_lights are found, array contains -1 integers for unused array slots. Required because numba works best with
93  constant return size.
94  """
95  light_distance = np.sqrt(np.sum((light_positions - position)**2, axis=1))
96  if np.sum(light_distance <= distance_threshold) >= max_lights:
97  load_index = np.argsort(light_distance)[:max_lights].flatten() # np.argpartition not supported by numba.
98  else:
99  tmp = np.argwhere(light_distance <= distance_threshold).flatten()
100  load_index = np.ones(max_lights, dtype=np.int64) * -1 # Mark invalid indices.
101  load_index[0:tmp.shape[0]] = tmp
102  return load_index
103 
104  def __init_numba_jit(self):
105  """!@brief Numba compile on object initialization function.
106 
107  @details Calls the @ref __check_lights_boost function once with dummy values to trigger numba jit compilation.
108  Numba jit instead of ahead of time compilation was chosen to enable CPU architecture specific optimizations.
109  """
110 
111  rospy.loginfo('Compiling numba functions for PositionChecker.')
112  init_light_pos = np.zeros((10, 2))
113  init_pos = np.ones(2)
114  self.__check_lights_boost(init_light_pos, init_pos, self.distance_threshold, self.max_lights)
115  rospy.loginfo('Numba compilation completed.')
